text: Mai Mala Buni (born 19 November 1967), is a Nigerian politician and the current governor of Yobe state, Nigeria. He is the caretaker chairman of the All Progressives Congress. He was elected governor during the 2019 Nigeria general elections under All Progressives Congress (APC) party. == Education == He holds bachelor's degree in International Relation from Espan Formation University, Benin Republic. He also holds a Master Degree in International Relations from Leeds Becket University, United Kingdom. == Career == Mala began his political career in 1992 when he contested and won a councilor sit under the platform of National Republican Convention (NRC) party, to represent Buni ward in the Gujba Local government council and subsequently elected as the speaker of the council. == References == Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Nigerian politicians Category:Alumni of the University of Leeds Category:People from Yobe State
title: Mai Mala Buni
